alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 9:43AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Union and Ouachita Parishes through 1045 AM CDT... At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Farmerville to 13 miles southwest of Brownsville-Bawcomville. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Farmerville, Richwood, Sterlington, Marion, Drew, Fondale, Haile, Millhaven, Folksville, Rocky Branch, Mineral Springs, Guthrie, Deshard and Fairbanks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for south central Arkansas...and north central Louisiana.
